Plastic ban boosts paper packaging biz.description: Indore: Blanket ban on plastic has come as a boon for packaging industry that has witnessed a growth of over 15 per cent and seen trending high with agriculture commodities and pharmaceuticals emerging as the top consumers. With stricter norms for quality packaging and food safety, demand for paper packaging has gone up, said industry players. In Indore region, a hub for agriculture and pharmaceutical units, demand for packaging has picked up among these units followed by e-commerce and fast moving consumer goods. Mohan Singh Raghuvanshi, a manufacturer of corrugated boxes said, “Packaging industry is getting good enquiries and demand as every industry is gradually moving towards paper packaging.” Industry players said, use of packaging has suddenly jumped for agriculture commodities such as for exotic fruits and vegetables among others. Rohit Jain, a dealer for fruits said, “Norms are getting stricter day by day and with this we have to ensure proper packaging of out items. Garlic, fruits and many vegetables these days are transported in proper packaging.” Paper packaging market shares about 30 per cent to overall packaging market and the share may grow in coming years. Amit Chawla, a drug manufacturer said, “Our packaging budget has gone up by about 20 per cent this year. As businesses are expanding and there are mandatory norms laid down by the government, packaging demand is growing.” According to dealers of paper in the city, local paper mills have also expanded production capacities. Recently a drop in paper prices owing to surplus supplies are seen further adding to the business of packaging amid some softening of prices. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. First flight from Indore to Dubai on Jul.description: INDORE: We had the promise. Now we have the date. Air India on Monday announced that the first international flight from Indore — to Dubai — will take off on July15. The announcement comes hardly three weeks after Devi Ahilyabai Holkar Airport of Indore received immigration clearance from the home ministry. The airline has already started taking bookings for the inaugural flight, and over a dozen people booked tickets within the first six hours. The flight — an Airbus A320 with 162 seats — is likely to take off from Indore on Mondays, Wednesdays and Saturdays and the return one from Dubai is on Tuesdays, Fridays and Sundays. From Indore, flight AI-903 will take off at 04.40pm and reach Dubai at 07.50pm IST on Mondays and Wednesdays. On Saturdays, it has a takeoff slot of 3.35pm, and will land in Dubai at 6.45pm. The flight, AI 904 will fly from Dubai at 4.40pm (3.30pm IST), and reach Indore at 9.20pm on all three days. “This is a tentative schedule, and it may change before commencement of flight operations,” said the airline. Air India local station officials said the flight timings have been scheduled to attract passengers not only from Indore, but from cities connected to Indore. “Passengers from Raipur, Nagpur and Goa would earlier have to go to Mumbai to take a flight to Dubai. Now, they will save time by coming to Indore,” said an official. Airport officials said that this would bring Indore airport the much-awaited international tag. “We have all the arrangements in place, including immigration clearance. The only wait is for an international flight to start,” said airport director Aryama Sanyal. The Travel Agents’ Association is upbeat. “There is a significant number of passengers to Dubai on this route. It will encourage other airlines to start international flights from Indore,” said the association’s state secretary Hemendra Singh Jadon. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bank manager, two associates create fake.description: INDORE: A bank manager and two of his associates were booked after a builder registered a case at Sanyogitaganj police station alleging that the accused had tried to defraud him by creating a fake bank account in his name when he was in Dubai and got a loan of Rs 1.5 crore sanctioned. Complainant Khurshid Khan, a resident of Almar Solitaire, told police that he came to know about the incident after he received a letter from the bank about the loan. When he inquired, he found out that a loan of Rs 1.5 crore had been initiated in the favour of his company Almas Builders and Developers by a private bank’s Chhawni branch. Police station in-charge Subodh Shotriya said, during investigation they found out that the manager and the employees had hatched a plan to get the loan sanctioned on the basis of forged documents and papers. A case was registered against the manager Rajkumar, son of Kanduram Meena, 34 and two consultants Rahul, 27, son of Mahendra Jain and Sanjeev Kanungo, 56. The complainant told police that he stayed with his relative at his home in Gurugram from August 1 to 4 in 2017 after which he had left for Dubai and returned in January 2018. “The loan process was initiated within this time period and it was then transferred to different bank accounts,” the complainant told the police. Police said that they were yet to arrest the accused. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Guard drives away with four-wheeler he w.description: INDORE: Director of a company in Milinda Manor building of the city had the shock of his life after his sedan that he had given to the guard for valet parking was stolen. Complainant Mahendrapal Kothari, a resident of Vijay Nagar area told police that he had gone to office and like every day handed over the keys of his sedan to the guard who parked it in the authorized parking of the building. When he returned in the evening to go back, he found that his vehicle was missing. After sifting through the footages of the CCTVs installed in the building, it was found that one of the guards who was parking the vehicle had stolen it. Tukoganj police said that a youth Ashok Choubey had joined two days back on a trial basis. He was kept under the supervision of an experienced guard Shubham Jain. On Saturday, when Mahendrapal reached the building, he gave the key to Shubham. Shubham passed on the key to Ashok and asked him to park the vehicle. The accused strategically parked it in a place from where he would be able to flee immediately and did not return the keys to Shubham. After Shubham and other guards were away on a break, the accused drove away the vehicle. “A case was registered against both Shubham and Ashok. He will be arrested at the earliest. It seems as if he had been planning this and had joined as a guard to steal the car. He conducted a recce first and then decided to steal it,” said Tukoganj police station in-charge Tehzeeb Qazi. Accused in Bhopal rape and murder case h.description: INDORE: Vishnu Prasad, 32, the accused in the rape and murder of the 10-year-old girl in Bhopal, was arrested by Khandwa police near the temple town of Omkareshwar in Madhya Pradesh on Monday. Prasad is an accused in raping and strangulating the girl, who lived in his neighbourhood and later dumping her body in a nullah with her hands tied and clothes ripped. “We have rounded up the accused in the morning. He is a resident of Khandwa and was traced near Omkareshwar,” Khandwa SP Dr Shiv Dayal told TOI. The accused has been taken to Bhopal where he will be further interrogated. Police is trying to speed up the investigation and has sought hearing in a fast track court for speedy justice. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MP: Five held for robbing jewellers in M.description: INDORE: Mandsaur police on Monday arrested five persons, including two minors, for snatching ornaments from two jwellers after shooting and injuring one of them in Daloda area ten days ago. The accused had accosted Vikas Pal and his father Heeralal Pal when they were closing their jwellery shop in Daloda on June 7. They had shot Heeralal in his leg and made away with ornaments from the shop. Eyewitnesses claimed that six masked men were seen fleeing the spot on three motorcycles towards Mandi area, following which a manhunt was launched, police said. During investigations, it was found that the accused were seen frequenting one Anil Banchada, 27, in Banekhedi area following which a team interrogated his wife. She confessed that six friends of Anil, two minors, had visited them on motorcycles. They hailed from Pune in Maharashtra. Two teams were sent to Pune to trace the accused, but they could not be found, police said adding on Monday, the investigators received tip-off about two youths attempting to sell ornaments in Mandsaur’s bullion market. A trap was laid and the accused rounded up. They confessed having committed the crime. They led to three of their accomplices staying at a local hotel, attempting to sell the booty. Apart from Anil, police arrested Shrikant Gaikwad, 28, Ajay Rathore, 19 and two minors and recovered a portion of silver ornaments weighing 3.90 kg from them. Two other accused were yet to be arrested. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. Narmada supply shutdown tomorrow, brace.description: INDORE: Water supply to the city may be affected for a couple of days since Indore Municipal Corporation (IMC) has planned shutdown of first and second phase of Narmada supply line at Rau Junction on June 20. Water supply through the 1200mm Narmada first and second phase supply line will be shut off as it is being shifted. “The shifting of line will be done to pave way for construction of a flyover in the area by National Highway Authority of India. The line is coming in way of the flyover’s pillars, owing to which it will be shifted for about 20 metre from its current location,” said IMC Narmada project official Sanjeev Shrivastava. Though a schedule for shifting of the line is yet to be finalized, officials have planned the shutdown during afternoon hours and finish it before night. The shutdown will affect supply of water in west part, which is connected with six overhead tanks under first and second phase Narmada line. “Supply in affected areas will be ensured through third phase of Narmada line,” said Shrivastava adding that the shutdown will be taken during afternoon hours and completed before night to minimize its impact on next day’s daily supply. The civic body officials have already started preparations for the shutdown. They said that supply in affected areas will be ensured with tankers. Civic body currently supplies 450-495 MLD of Narmada water through three phases of supply network. Of it, 135 MLD water is supplied through first and second phase, while remaining 360 MLD is supplied through third phase. This is for the second time in past one month when IMC is going to undertake a shutdown for line shifting work. Earlier, Narmada third phase supply line was shifted for the same project. It had reduced supply by 60 per cent. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nShopItDaily grocery shopping portal or.description: It was an afternoon dedicated to ladies of Shiv Nest society, who had a gala time participating in a plethora of activities at the brunch that was organised by the ShopItDaily team. Almost 50 women had taken part in a variety of competitions, which was hosted by Indore’s one-of-a-kind grocery shopping portal.  At the do, women enjoyed playing one-minute games, which gave a fun twist to their everyday routine. Not only did they spend a delightful time, but also learnt the nuances of online grocery shopping techniques. The participants admitted the crash course will help them choose products they want on an everyday basis intelligently and also strike good deals.  The event was executed by the 14 interns of ShopItDaily, who had come up with fun activities at this brunch. The women participated in six games, and one of the highlights was the Grocery Songs one, where they had to play an antakshari of sorts by using parody of grocery items and jingles. Rashmit was announced the winner of this.  In Yes, No, Maybe, participants had to answer a slew of questions without mentioning these three words. This was won by Shikha Arya, Ropa Bagha. Ball & Pin, Safety Pin and Bangle, Tongue Twister and Straw and Ball were won by Nikharika Devi and Jasmeet Kaur, Radha Mahpa, Mansi and Ankita Semi respectively. 26-year-old youth killed as bikes collid.description: INDORE: A 26-year-old youth was killed and his nephew sustained injuries when a speeding two-wheeler collided head-on with the bike they were riding on in Aerodrome area in front of Ankit Hospital on Saturday night. The youth, Vishwadeep, son of Raju and his nephew were on their way home to New Mahesh Nagar in Malharganj when the collision took place. The duo was rushed to MY Hospital, where Vishwadeep was declared brought dead by doctors. Vishwadeep’s family members and friends, who had reached MY Hospital, were so shocked and couldn’t believe that he had succumbed to injuries. They reportedly created nuisance at the hospital. They fought with the hospital staff and forcefully took Vishwadeep’s body to a private hospital to get him checked. But they were told that he had died a while ago. The video of youths carrying the body out of the hospital in their car to a private hospital, while shouting, went viral on social media and the hospital authority also informed police. They, however, later brought it back to MYH for postmortem examination. The body was handed over to family members only after postmortem examination.  Police have registered a case and the number of vehicle which had hit Vishwadeep’s bike was noted down based on CCTV footage. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. After barrage of criticism, Railway scra.description: INDORE: No, you won't get a 'champi' on any train from Indore. Western railway on Saturday scrapped the decision to introduce head and foot massages on trains after it was bombarded with objections and criticism. "The proposal to introduce head and/or foot massage services on trains originating from Indore station was initiated by Ratlam Division. As soon as the proposal came to the notice of higher authorities of Western Railways, it was withdrawn," said a press release, issued by Western Railway CPRO Ravinder Bhakar. Western Railway appreciates the "positive suggestions" from public representatives, railway consumers and public, it added. On June 8, DRM R N Sunkar tweeted that Ratlam Division was going to start massage service on 39 trains to "add to passenger comfort". It went viral, and made for eye-popping headlines but triggered outrage in certain sections. On Friday, outgoing Lok Sabha Speaker Sumitra Mahajan wrote to railway minister Piyush Goyal, seeking 'clarity' on the plan. She pointed out that it would make women passengers uncomfortable. "It may throw up some questions regarding the safety of passengers, especially women," she wrote, and wanted to know if permission had been sought from the railway ministry. Earlier, newly-crowned Indore MP Shankar Lalwani had objected to it and written to Goyal on June 13, saying that it's "against Indian culture to offer such services in presence of women". "In my opinion, providing passengers medical aid and doctors is important and not these 'standard-less' services," Lalwani wrote. "Based on feedback from public, and considering social and economic conditions and improvement of passenger services, the proposed (massage) facility has been put up for review. Along with the proposed head and foot massage facility on running trains, tender for the same facility at Indore railway station has also been cancelled," senior PRO of Ratlam Division Jitendra Kumar Jayant told TOI. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Indore: AC manufacturers chill in the he.description: INDORE: Soaring temperature has propelled sales of air-conditioner (AC) in city and state. This season sales of AC have registered a growth of around 30 per cent. Madhya Pradesh led by Indore has emerged as a potential market for ACs and coolers. Between April and May, sales of ACs jumped by an average of around 30 per cent as against a year ago in the same period, owing to scorching summer and spate of energy efficient models in market, said leading AC manufacturers and dealers. Mukundan Menon, sales and marketing president of a leading air conditioning brand having 12.5% of market share said, “we have seen a very strong growth of 30% in sales of ACs as compared to last year. Air coolers have also registered a jump of around 50 per cent in sales.” Menon expect sales of ACs and coolers to remain good in June as well. AC manufacturers and dealers said that upgraded technologies in AC, energy-efficient models and easy finance scheme led to the spike in sales. A leading appliances and electronics company, which has its headquarters at Japan, business head (air-conditioners group) Gaurav Sah said, “Triggered by the heightened demand for cooling appliances in summer season, AC sales in Madhya Pradesh started on a positive note. We have clocked more than 40% value growth in ACs in April and May, on the back of a strong demand in the region.” Demand for inverter AC clubbed with low on electricity consumption models ruled the market, said manufacturers. Indore registered a record high temperature of 44 degrees Celsius on June 7. Prior to this, on June 3, 1991, the highest maximum temperature recorded in Indore was 45.8 degrees Celsius, according to records of Met. Gaurav Pahwa from a leading retail chain of electronics in Indore said, “besides temperature, finance has become easy with lots of friendly options that speed up the decision making of customers. Also companies have brought down cost of their products in a range that fits the pockets of customers from different walks of life.” Retailers and dealers said, with new technology, customers have become technologically advance and make purchases after enquiring about energy efficiency and type of gas used among others. Sajjan bats for Bala Bachchan as MP Cong.description: INDORE: PWD minister Sajjan Singh Verma on Monday hinted at major changes in the six-month-old Kamal Nath cabinet, saying six ministers may be given different roles, and pitched for home minister Bala Bachchan as the next MP Congress president. "Based on my political experience, it's my personal view that home minister Bala Bachchan should be given responsibility of heading MPCC. The state is a house of around 22% ST population, and maximum MLAs of Congress belong to this community, including Bachchan. They helped Congress form the government in the state," the PWD minister said at a press meet in Indore. "Bachchan is a strong leader and making him state Congress president will send a good message," he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

IIT-Indore working with US varsity to de.description: INDORE: Research collaboration by Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Indore and Purdue University of US can open new avenues in the field of energy storage and make batteries thermally safe in future. The collaboration is based on how to make batteries more effective and ensure more energy storage at economical rates. The institutes are working on sodium-ion batteries, which are different from lithium-ion batteries and could be good for sustainable storage. “Our primary focus is energy storage and that’s why we have collaborated with IIT Indore as they are also working on energy storage. We really wanted to make batteries that are thermally safer. Safety is paramount,” said professor of Purdue University, Vilas Pol who has also been working as an ad-junct faculty member of IIT Indore. Pol holds Guinness World Record for being fastest to arrange all elements of modern periodic table. “We’re putting sensors inside battery. Currently, sensors are on top of the battery so the sensors detect it only, when battery has thermal runaway and heat comes out. But, by that time battery is already exploding. We’re putting 3-D printed sensors behind electorate cell. So once temperature starts rising, we can switch off the battery before thermal runaway,” said Pol while talking to TOI. “Several students of IIT Indore are working in laboratories at Purdue University,” said director of IIT Indore, Pradeep Mathur. Devotees allowed to enter sanctum sancto.description: INDORE: Devotees visiting Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain will now be able to enter the sanctum sanctorum on weekdays from 11am to 4pm irrespective of number of devotees. A decision to this effect was taken by Shri Mahakaleshwar Mandir Prabandh Samiti on Tuesday. The facility will be available from Monday to Saturday. Until now, devotees were restricted from entering the sanctum sanctorum, on Sundays and Mondays. On regular days, when the crowd of devotees grew, the temple management committee imposed restrictions to ensure safety of pilgrims. The committee was flooded with complaints about devotees reaching Ujjain from far-off places and feeling rejected, when denied entry to the sanctum sanctorum, where the main Shivlinga is situated. The committee decided to ensure seamless entry to the sanctorum for five hours on weekdays on an experimental basis. Beyond this stipulated hours entry to the sanctorum will be decided as per the number of devotees waiting outside. If the number is more the entry will be restricted. The committee has also decided to come out with 5gm silver coins with imprints of the temple. The coins will be made available from prasad counters for a certain amount of donations. The committee also concluded that the temple employees should be provided a dress code. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nFrom cricket to cycling, youngsters co.description: It was an afternoon dedicated to music and dance as 30 enthusiastic dancers from the city came together for a parade titled Heart Fest recently.  Fascinated by glamorous reality shows, these amateur dancers showcased genres as varied as Bollywood style, hip-hop, abstract and jazz. And judging this enthusiastic bunch were twins Prayag and Prayas, dancers/actors who have been working under the guidance of Remo D’souza in Mumbai and have done many TV shows.  The duo traces its roots to Dewas and since it is quite close to Indore, they would often come to the city for events earlier. Speaking to us about their current visit, they said, “It feels nice to come back to our roots and that too, as judges. This dance competition is only reminding us of our days in Indore when we used to participate, just like these kids. We have been part of a series of competitions and that struggle helped us grow, giving us the confidence to move to Mumbai.”  Talking about Indore, they added, “This city has a different charm. The love and opportunities that we got in Indore were extraordinary. In 2005, when we moved to Mumbai, the struggle didn’t look that difficult. We just threw ourselves in to dance and learned every possible thing we could .” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

E-tendering scam: EOW summons two ex-sec.description: BHOPAL: Madhya Pradesh state economic offences wing on Tuesday summoned two government officers, who were secretaries to former BJP minister Narottam Mishra, for questioning in connection with the probe into the alleged Rs 80,000 cr e-tendering scam. Notices have been issued to Nirmal Awasthi and Virendra Pandey, who were on deputation from water resources department and law department to Mishra's office. Sources in the agency said they will be questioned in connection with a tender awarded to Gujarat-based Sorathia Velji Ratna & Co in 2018. Sources say Awasthi went to the EOW office on Wednesday to have his statement recorded. The water resources department had floated a Rs 116-crore tender for a project that the firm bagged for Rs 113 crore, and when the letter of acceptance was given, the amount was reduced to Rs 105 crore, say sources. EOW investigation to focus on rates, tendering procedureFirst of all, the tender went at a low rate and then there was further reduction of around Rs 8 crore. We want to know the reason for the modification in rates and investigate the tendering procedures,” said an EOW official. Sorathia Velji Ratna & Co, a company registered in Vadodara, was granted a 30-day ‘transit temporary anticipatory bail’ from Gujarat high court, following a joint petition moved by 10 people associated with the firm. The bail period ended a couple of days ago and EOW officials are trying to arrest those named in their FIR, say sources. The petitioners — Meghli Velji Sorathia, Ashok Velji Bambhaniya, Diwaliben Sorathia, Bharat Sorathia, Chandresh Sorathia, Mahesh Sorathia, Haresh Sorathia, Paresh Sorathia, Manoj Vasava and Raju Gehani — had informed the court that they apprehended arrest in connection with the FIR registered by EOW in Bhopal and sought bail, said sources. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Mandu as UNESCO World Heritage site: Dha.description: INDORE: As a first step for the heritage property Mandu to be included in the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization’s (UNESCO) World Heritage list, Dhar administration submitted a nomination dossier to the state tourism board which was unveiled by state tourism minister Surendra Singh Baghel on Wednesday. The dossier consists of the iconic heritage property’s legacy portrayed in about 2000 pages and 200 images. “We initiated the process and there are some guidelines prescribed by the UNESCO which we followed and completed the dossier in a record time of six months. We have submitted the dossier to the minister today and a team will be presenting the proposal to the state tourism board and if convinced, they will forward it to the Government of India,” Dhar district collector Shrikant Bhanot told TOI. In the next step, the state government would then be forwarding the dossier to the ministry of culture, from where it will be sent to International Conference on Operations Management and Operations Research (ICOMOR), the advisory body of UNESCO. “The entire evaluation, beginning from the state tourism board, will take place in 15 months. They will then generate a report to the ministry of culture stating if they are directly adding it to the list or any other requirement to be fulfilled. As per UNESCO, the year starts from September 30 and it will be declared by 2020-21 slot or by 2021-22 slot,” said an Indore-based consultation company’s planning and designing department head, Garima Rajput. The dossier is an inclusive effort to preserve both tangible and intangible cultural heritage of the town in the form of rich tribal culture, art, skills, festivals, cuisine, environment, fauna, rains and language. It also focuses on national and international tourism enhancement that strengthens the backbone of economic activities in the town, which further generates year-round employment activities for its inhabitants, she said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Babus on vacation, people wait longer fo.description: INDORE: Hundreds of complainants reaching weekly public hearing on Tuesday had little help on offer as most of the senior administrative officials including district collector were absent. The weekly public hearing at collectorate witnessed around 250 applicants turning up with their grievances. But presence of only few administrative officials including ADM Dinesh Jain along with deputy collectors Shashwat Sharma and Anshul Khare kept public waiting. Collector Lokesh Kumar Jatav, zila panchayat CEO Neha Meena and ADM Kailash Wankhede gave the proceedings a miss due to their on- going vacation. ADM Bhavya Mittal and Ajaydeo Sharma also did not attend public hearing due to other assignments while other SDMs were also absent due to various reasons. The situation became worse for applicants, especially elderly and women accompanied by children, who had to stand in long queues outside public hearing hall, sweating and looking for arrangements of drinking water only to find no respite. Neha, wife of Sunil Chouhan of Musakhedi reached public hearing with her one-and-a-half month old daughter and registered a complaint against her mother-in-law and sister-in-law, who are ASHA workers. The woman alleged that her mother-in-law and sister-in-law illegally carried out sex determination of her daughter while complainant was pregnant as when they came to know that child will be a girl, they tried to force Neha for abortion. “To this, I informed my parents, who admitted me to a hospital in Dewas for delivery. The husband’s family members have now refused me entry in the house” Neha said. To this, deputy collector Shashwat Sharma directed complainant to respective police station to lodge complaint. In the hearing, residents of Kalindi Gold City approached ADM with a complaint of inflated power bills received by around 150 families in locality. Jain assured the complainants to look into the matter. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\nMaruti Ciaz Hybrid launched at a grand.description: The grand Maruti Bash at Vrindavan Garden, Sayaji was full of entertainment. Around 600-700 of Maruti's high profile customers and media financers were invited to commemorate the launch of the all new Maruti Ciaz Hybrid. The event began at 7.30 pm followed by enthralling dance performances and business presentations. There was also an exciting contest wherein people had to complete the slogan "I like Maruti because..." and the best description won an iPad. The evening was made more special by the 'Selfie treat' as all the invitees were given a framed selfie with the Ciaz Hybrid to take away as a memento.  Amidst all the enjoyment, the garden area of the venue was filled with talks of appreciation for the aerodynamically and fuel efficient car. The DDiS 200 diesel engine provisioned with an Integrated Starter Generator was a hot topic for discussion as well. The car is 4490 mm long, 1730 mm wide and has an overall height of 1485mm. To make the drive swifter, the wheelbase has been kept 2650 mm wide whereas the minimum ground clearance is about 170 mm. In order to avoid jerky turns, this car is provisioned with a turn radius of about 5.4 meters and the back is adorned with a boot space of 510 inches. The interior has highly modernised features like proficiently designed personal reading lamps, camera assisted reverse parking system, keyless push start, rear sunshades and intelligently featured rear AC vents. For a homely feeling and comfort, the interior has a satisfactory utility space and a comfortable seating space for five people. The stunning exterior and highly-equipped interior rendered the car as the showstopper of the event.  It's not just a swift car but also a safe one. The dual airbags can absorb jerks and shocks in the blink of an eye. Whereas the ABS along with EBD, the rear parking sensors, high tensile strength steel and TECT (Total Effective Control Technology) ensures maximum safety. The front brakes (ventilated disc), rear brakes (drum), rear suspension (torsion beam) and front suspension (McPherson strut) puts this car in sync with safety standards. There are varied colour shades available in the Maruti Ciaz Smart Hybrid including metallic, brown, pearl and dignity. You can choose the one that suits your style. High mileage, cost-effectiveness, a touch-screen infotainment system, Smartplay (tuned behind the wheels), safety and looks to die for, make this car a must buy during the festive season. Available at your nearest Maruti showrooms. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bumper arrival of onions at mandi causes.description: INDORE: Chaos witnessed at Devi Ahilyabai Fal Evam Sabji Mandi on Thursday after bumper arrival of onion crops that led to traffic jams in the area. As the state government has started purchasing onion crops at support price of Rs 800/quintal under Bhavantar Scheme, farmers of around 100km radius of the district have started reaching the mandi with their fresh crops. The number grew late on Wednesday night when the administration had to shut entry of vehicles to handle the situation. The same resulted in long queues of loading vehicles carrying crops especially onions outside the mandi while a number of trucks, which were parked inside also got stuck due to haphazardly parked vehicles. The traffic jams in and outside the mandi not only affected the business but also caused huge inconvenience to commuters. Due to the chaos, the mandi administration recorded arrival of only around 250 quintals of onion against the average arrival of around 50,000 quintal onion crops. This month, the mandi has recorded total arrival of about 4.46 lakh onion crops. The officials informed that market has capacity to accommodate arrival of 1 lakh quintal crops but on Wednesday night, over 1.25 lakh crops arrived. The traders alleged that the mandi administration has deployed 76 security guards to work in three shifts but very few of them were there to manage the traffic. “Sheer negligence on the part of mandi officials led to such chaotic situation in mandi on Thursday. There are many encroachments and no proper arrangement was made to guide the traffic. The market also lacks basic facilities including drinking water for the farmers, porters and traders,” traders’ association president Haji Maqsood said. According to mandi secretary Satish Patel, “The situation of traffic jams reported due to a sudden increase in arrival of onion crops. As decided, the vehicles carrying crops for selling/unloading in mandi will be given entry from 10pm to 9am and remaining time will be there for vehicles loading the crops and going out. A work plan is also prepared for opening a new entry/exit gate in the mandi”. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

'Gumnam Hai Koi' brings marathi thriller.description: Well known Marathi actor Madhura Velankar's play ‘Gumnaam hai koi’ was staged at the DAVV auditorium of Indore on Saturday and Sunday. The drama produced by the Mumbai’s Bhadrakali productions traces the journey of a writer Revati Karkhanis in whose life a tragic incident leaves her emotionally vulnerable. She then starts facing hallucinations, strange visions. It takes the audience through a roller-coaster of emotions faced by the protagonist and other characters. The lead role was played by Madhura Velankar and the play was directed by Mangesh Kadam. The thrilling drama, was staged five times over the weekend by Sanand Nyas group, much to the delight of Indore's audience. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Congress spokesperson pushes cop at pres.description: INDORE: Congress’s Indore spokesperson Sunny Rajpal got into an altercation with police when he was denied entry into a press conference of state PWD minister Sajjan Singh Verma here on Monday. Rajpal, who was stopped by head constable Atal Bihari Sharma, pushed the cop aside and entered the conference hall at Residency Kothi. A video of the episode went viral on social media, evoking strong reactions from BJP, which accused the ruling Congress of highhandedness and “oppression of government servants”. The policeman has refused to press charges. The video shows that the face-off between Rajpal and the cop went beyond an exchange of words. The Congressman, however, denied pushing the head constable. “I was already present at the meeting of the minister with senior officials, but had gone out to the washroom. The press conference began after the meeting. I requested the cops deployed for security outside the gates to let me enter but to no avail,” Rajpal told TOI. The Congressman, however, denied pushing the head constable, and said, “I requested him (the policeman) repeatedly. During this commotion, he got pushed due to the crowd present there. It was not intentional.” BJP city president Gopikrishna Nema claimed that such incidents have got more frequent in the six months since Congress came to power in Madhya Pradesh. “Congress leaders, in order to show their might, treat government officials as personal servants. It lowers the morale of government officials and in the end public work suffers,” Nema said. City SP Jyoti Umath said senior officers have been informed about the incident. “Head constable Atal Bihari Sharma, who is posted at Sanyogitaganj police station, was deployed outside the gates of Residency Kothi. He has been advised to give details of the incident in writing, and if he has any complaint regarding the incident,” she said. Sharma has decided not to file any complaint. “I have no personal enmity with Rajpal. I was doing my duty. I will not file any complaint,” he said. In Video:Watch: Congress leader Sunny Rajpal misbehaves with a policeman in MP’s IndoreDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

In poll year, IMC budget may not have ne.description: Indore: Indore Municipal Corporation (IMC) budget for the 2019-20 fiscal year is expected to be a populists with focus on expediting ongoing development projects and no new taxes. Mayor Malini Gaud is expected to table her last budget on Wednesday before civic body elections. Official sources said that this budget would focus on improving basic amenities besides provisions for development of new roads proposed under master plan 2021. “This year’s budget will focus on improving infrastructure and speeding up ongoing development projects especially those related with road construction,” said an official. He said that projects like solar power plant at Jalood pumping station and construction of an elevated corridor at Mhow Naka would also be given approval. “Mayor is also expected to announce change in policy of commercial space owned by IMC like those in Shastri Marg, where renters have made changes in building structure to utilize the space as per their need,” said officials. “Instead of cancellation of their allotment, the renters might get an option to buy that space with a penalty,” they explained. The budget is also expected to focus on formation of a new groundwater recharge policy with involvement of private agencies to encourage citizens for rainwater harvesting. Construction of new overhead tanks to improve water supply system in outskirt areas of city is also expected to get sanction, sources said. IMC’s opposition members have also geared up to corner officials over delay in projects that were sanctioned in last year’s budget. IMC leader of opposition Fozia Sheikh Alim on Tuesday met chairman Ajay Singh Naruka and demanded to hold question hour for corporators on Wednesday. “This would save a lot of time for the second day and corporators will have ample of time for budget discussion,” claimed Alim. Naruka promised them to consider their suggestion and take it up to mayor and commissioner for approval. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Vayu cools Indore for now, temperature d.description: INDORE: After hovering over 40 degree Celsius mark for the past few weeks, temperature in Indore dropped four degrees on Thursday as a result of the effect of storm Vayu which touched Gujarat coast in the afternoon. The storm brought in high amount of moisture in western part of Madhya Pradesh including Malwa-Nimar leading to a drop in temperature and cloudy sky over the region. The maximum temperature in Indore dropped to 37.6 degree one degree above average, which was recorded at 41 degree on Wednesday. The minimum temperature was recorded at 26.4 degree as compared to 29 degree on Wednesday. Rainfall was recorded in traces by Meteorological department in Indore throughout the day. The weather department has predicted chances of rain and thunderstorm over the Malwa-Nimar region on Friday and Saturday as well, after which effect of the storm will subside leading to rise in temperature. “However, the temperature will not reach till 45- 46 degrees as one or other system will continue to bring in light rains and moisture into the region. The monsoon is likely to set in Malwa-Nimar around June 25,” Indian Meteorological department official from Bhopal said. In other districts like Shajapur, Ujjain, Gwalior, Bhopal as well, the maximum temperature was recorded below 40 degree Celsius. In Khandwa, Khargone and Dhar, the temperatures remained above 40 degree, however it was marginally lower than the maximum temperature on Wednesday in all three districts. The relative humidity across the region was also quite high on Thursday. In Indore, the humidity in the morning was 66 per cent, whereas the relative humidity in the evening was 38 per cent. While in the western part of Madhya Pradesh the effect of Vayu led to cooling down of temperature, in the eastern Madhya Pradesh rainfall activities were observed due to the cyclonic circulation over the Bay of Bengal.
