\nSchool Student showcase their painting.description: Students between the ages of 10-15 years exhibited their paintings during a recent charity exhibition in the city.  It marked the first time the students had participated in a professional exhibition. The students first underwent training during a month-long workshop in April and then showed off their skills here.  Renowned artists Avadesh Yadav and Shabnam graced this occasion and encouraged the youngsters. Said Yadav, “This kind of professional exposure of hosting will create a whole new group of artists who will take the legacy of this city forward. I am really happy with the work displayed by these kids here and wish them all the luck for their future.”  The kids were equally excited. Nimisha Agarawal (14), a class X student, said, “The subject of my painting is the freedom for a woman. The wings attached to her express her desire to fly freely in the sky.” Rakesh Mahajan, another 14-year-old, said, “I visited a painting exhibition in Mumbai recently and after that, I wanted to showcase my own painting at a professional exhibition and I am very happy to do it for a cause.” The money generated from this three-day long exhibition will be donated to build toilets in the rural areas of the city. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Stamp and registrar department receive 3.description: INDORE: In the process to finalize collector’s guideline of property rates for 2019-20, stamp and registrar department has received around 35 objections against its proposal of increasing 5 to 40 per cent of rate in around 400 localities of the district. “The office, which had invited claims and objections against proposed guidelines of the property rates from June 12 to June 18, has received around 35 objections till Tuesday evening. The same will be put up in district-level evaluation committee, which will be held next week, for disposal before sending it to central evaluation committee in Bhopal for consent,” senior district registrar BK More told TOI. He added that during week-long process, local office has not forwarded any proposal/report to Bhopal for consideration. In a meeting of district-level evaluation committee headed by collector Lokesh Kumar Jatav, an increase of 5 to 40 per cent in 396 out of total 4280 localities was proposed while for remaining around 91 per cent of areas (3884 localities), guidelines for property rates remained unchanged. It was learnt, stamp and registrar department had found in its survey that around 800 areas had witnessed property registration in last financial year at above current guidelines. These areas witnessed a surge in property rates, on which registries were documented, between 5 and 65 per cent and therefore, they had proposed a hike in the guideline for 2019-20 in the similar ratio. On facing objections by district-level evaluation committee, office then agreed for maximum rise of 40 per cent in property-rate in total around 9 per cent localities. Only four localities were then proposed about 40 per cent hike in the guideline for the next financial year. After getting consent from central evaluation committee, proposed collector’s guideline of property rate for current financial year is likely to be implemented from July 1. Soil survey for better yield begins in I.description: INDORE: Aimed at increasing productivity and guiding farmers to harvest appropriate crops to reap maximum benefits, the agriculture department has launched a survey to identify quality of soil. “The department has selected Asrawadkhurd village for the survey under Soil Health Card Scheme. It has started taking samples of every farm in the village to check its quality and prepare the report. The report card will help farmers increase their productivity by balancing nutrients and other factors of soil. Based on the report, the farmers will be given tips to go for appropriate crops to get good harvest,” agriculture joint director Vijay Jaat said. The card will contain report of soil’s health and level of nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium, magnesium, sulphur and other nutrients. It will also prescribe appropriate fertilizers, seeds and techniques to make a good balance of nutrients in soil, he added. Asrawadkhurd farmers have been asked for farming at half of the agricultural land in their traditional way and use guidance provided by the department in the remaining area. The harvest of both the methods will be compared to know benefits from the scheme. Subsequently, farmers will be encouraged to opt for better one. “Asrawadkhurd has been selected on pilot basis to test soil’s health. It will help farmers getting better harvest. On success of the project, the survey will be carried out in other villages,” Jaat said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Police sniff role of insider in robbery.description: INDORE: Dwarkapuri police are investigating the involvement of micro-finance loan recovery collection centre officials in the robbery that took place at their office on Monday afternoon. Three masked men had barged into their office in Vidur Nagar and walked away with Rs six lakh on gunpoint within a span of two minutes. The accused also fired shots in the air to thwart attempts of the employees and customers and fled on a motorcycle. ASP Manish Khatri said that seven teams were formed to probe the case and the policemen have sifted through over 50 CCTVs installed in the area to track the movement of the accused after they conducted the robbery. “We have recorded the statements of the bank officials and we are interrogating them more on the crime. The way the robbery was conducted, it seems that the accused knew the working of the bank and someone from the inside helped them,” said Khatri. SP Yusuf Qureshi said that the district force was alerted immediately and victims of the robbery would be questioned thoroughly to trace and identify the accused. ASP Khatri said that the office was being operated out of a rented hall. The landlord had also not informed police about the tenants and action may be initiated against him as well. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Probe ordered against TI for \u2018misbe.description: BARWANI: SP Barwani has ordered a probe against Rajpur town inspector for allegedly abusing and misbehaving with women, who were returning home after listening to Bhagwat Katha on Saturday night, and thrashing small vendors. The investigation was ordered after a delegation of BJP workers led by Khargone MP Gajendra Patel complained against the town inspector Anil Bamaniya on Sunday. They handed over a memorandum to the SP against Bamaniya. They alleged that Bamniya used to consume liquor and misbehave with owners of small stall like tea, pan, ice cream and snacks. On Saturday night too, he abused and misbehaved with women, who were returning home after listening to Bhagwat Katha. MP Patel asked the SP to inform him about the action to be taken in the case. He has also sent copies of memorandum to director general of police, IG Indore and Khargone DIG. Superintendent of police DR Teniwar told TOI that primary inquiry will be done by Barwani additional superintendent of police Sunita Rawat. He will take appropriate action in the case after receiving the probe report. BJP district president Om Khandelwal said that Bamaniya was behaving like British officials with the small vendors. On the other hand, TI Bamaniya told TOI that BJP leaders were against him because he had stopped selling of liquor illegally in the area. “On Saturday night, few people vandalized a liquor shop and thrashed its workers. Police have booked five people under sections 294, 323, 506, 427 and 34 of the IPC and Excise Act,” he claimed. During Lok Sabha elections, he was transferred from Rajpur for violation of model code of conduct. A few days ago, he was again shifted back to Rajpur. MP: 2 drown in Narmada river, 6 rescued.description: INDORE: Two persons drowned, while six others had a narrow escape when a group of youngsters ventured into deep waters of river Narmada in Omkareshwar on Monday. The victims, all residents of Burhanpur, were visiting the temple town to offer prayers and bathing in the river in the morning when the incident took place, Madhanta police said. Eyewitnesses claimed that the group of youngsters were screaming in playful gestures, ignoring warnings of people nearby, when one of them ventured into deep water. Another youngster attempted to reel him into the ghat, but was also pulled by the strong current. “The deceased gave been identified as Vhsial Mahajan, 18 and Ganesh Mahajan, 19,” Mandhata police station-incharge Jagdish Chandra Patidar told TOI. They were a group from Burhanpur who had moved on their motorcycles to visit Maheshwar and Omkareshwar. They reached Omkareshwar on Sunday night. In the morning, they were going to the temple, before they bathed in the river. Boats men on the ghats managed to pull the rest of the youths ashore. They also pulled the victims from water and rushed them to a hospital, Patidar said. Doctors at the hospital could not revive the victims, he added. A post-mortem examination of the bodies was conducted. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagda to be declared 53rd district of Ma.description: INDORE: The long-pending demand to declare Nagda as 53rd district of Madhya Pradesh is likely to be fulfilled in near future since state government has sought details of three tehsils of Ujjain district and one of Ratlam district to finalize the proposal. Nagda district will be constituted by merging Nagda, Khacharod and Mahidpur tehsils of Ujjain district and Alot tehsil of Ratlam district. Ujjain collector has written to sub-divisional officers (SDOs) of Nagda, Khacharod and Mahidpur to furnish required details along with their maps by Thursday. The SDOs will submit the details in three formats. In format 1, they have to present district-wise classification of their respective tehsils with details of total number of panchayat/patwari halka (area) of rural and urban parts. In format 2, they will present details of Ujjain district post partition of Nagda, Khachrod and Mahidpur tehsils. In format 3, details of tehsil-wise patwari halka containing revenue inspector circles, number of villages in patwari halka, khasra (plot) number, area of villages and population as per Census 2011, will be provided. Besides this, details of facilities, including anaj mandi, veterinary hospital, allopathic hospital, primary health centres, schools, colleges, post offices have been sought. In 2008 assembly elections, ex-MLA Dilip Gurjar had moved an application in assembly session to declare Nagda as a district. The then revenue minister had promised him to pay attention on his demand. But, later, senior officials rejected his plea. In 2013 assembly polls, too, the issue had sought public attention. But the demand is being fulfilled now after 2018 assembly elections. “The SDOs have been asked to furnish details as required by government. The process to declare Nagda as 53rd district of state, however, will take some time,” Ujjain collector Shashank Mishra said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Indore cops get BJP to cover up poster w.description: INDORE: A poster at a BJP rally with the face of West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee superimposed on a leopard perched in the hands of BJP general secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya, sparked a row in Indore on Tuesday. Police had to intervene and force the organisers to cover up the morphed picture. Vijayvargiya, who is credited with BJP’s stunning success in Bengal in the recent Lok Sabha elections, is leading the party’s charge for the 2021 assembly polls there. The saffron party and Trinamool Congress are locked in a tense and often bloody battle of supremacy in Bengal, and its ripples were felt 1500km away, in Indore on Tuesday. The poster was erected at Bombay Bazaar on the route of a ‘Kisan Akrosh rally’ organised by Vijayvargiya to highlight the plight of farmers in Congress rule in Madhya Pradesh. On one of the stages put up to welcome the rally, BJP minority cell leader Sajid Khan Royal had erected the morphed photo, showing Mamata in the grip of Vijayvargiya. Police took note of it and before the rally could reach Sajid’s stage, police got him to cover Mamata’s face. “We had no intention to demean the Bengal chief minister. We showed her as a tiger, but sitting in the hands of another tiger (Vijayvargiya),” Sajid told TOI. “We had a fight with the police. They gave no reason to cover the poster. But we relented as we did not want to spoil the rally,” Sajid said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

ASI found hanging from ceiling fan at hi.description: MHOW: An assistant sub-inspector posted at Ghatabillod police outpost under Pithampur Sector-3 police station limits in Dhar district allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself from the ceiling of his house on Tuesday. The incident came to light when a constable Nawal Singh reached his house since he was not responding to phone calls of officials, including Pithampur Sector-3 police station in charge, Mahendra Singh Bhadoriya. Bhadoriya had asked Singh to look for the ASI, Man Singh Parmar, at his rented house near the outpost. Singh found the ASI hanging from ceiling fan at the house and he immediately informed Bhadoriya about it. A police team arrived at the scene and took the body to Dhar district hospital for postmortem examination. Parmar was a native of a remote village in Jhabua district. He was in charge of theoutpost His colleagues said that he was under depression for past few days. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Registration for CET gets extension till.description: INDORE: Students can now register themselves for Common Entrance Test (CET) type I examination till June 15 with Devi Ahilya Vishwavidyalaya (DAVV) extending the deadline as four new undergraduate courses have been added in Group A2 of CET type I. The new courses are BSc (electronics), BSc (hons) physics, BSc (hons) mathematics, BSc (hons) applied statistics and analytics. "Some of the new courses that have been cleared by executive council to be rolled out from this academic session have been added in CET type I examination. As there are 13 days remaining to conduct CET type I examination, we have extended last date of registration," media spokesperson of DAVV, Dr Chandan Gupta told TOI. The application fee is Rs 1500 and student, who has applied in group A2, will not have to apply again, he added. Currently, over 19000 students have applied for various DAVV courses out of which over 16000 applicants have registered themselves for various undergraduate and post graduate courses for CET type I. Online registrations for other courses have also been extended till June 15. Students, who have already applied in Group H/I/J/K will not have to apply again, they will be able to update their choices of programmes. The application fee is Rs 750," said Gupta. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mishmash of National Anthem and Vande Ma.description: INDORE: National Anthem or Vande Mataram? Confusion prevailed at the BJP-led Indore Municipal Corporation budget meeting on Wednesday when council members started singing "Jana Gana Mana" when they were expected to sing "Vande Mataram". Worse still, the Anthem was stopped abruptly for them to sing "Vande". It triggered a political controversy, with Congress corporators alleging that by stopping the National Anthem midway, BJP leaders had violated the Prevention of Insults to National Honour Act, 1971. It’s the practice at IMC that meetings of the mayoral council and general body begin with "Vande Mataram" and end with "Jana Gana Mana". However, on Wednesday, some mayoral council members stood up and started singing the National Anthem, while others sang the customary Vande Mataram. Adding to the confusion, some members stopped singing and started pointing out the mistake. After some more confusion, everyone began singing Vande Mataram. IMC Leader of Opposition Fozia Sheikh Alim said, "It was a clear dishonour of the National Anthem. It was very disappointing to see that public representatives are confused between the National Anthem and the National Song. An FIR should be registered against all of them." Legal experts said that the mistake could attract legal action if it was deliberate. "If it was a mistake, then there should not be any action against the members. Or else it would attract legal action for dishonour of the National Anthem," said senior advocate Anand Mohan Mathur. IMC chairman Ajay Singh Naruka said, "Those who sang the National Anthem seemed to be confused between the National Song and National Anthem." Mayor Malini Gaud, however, blamed the “noisy” opposition for the confusion. “The opposition was creating a ruckus before the meeting began. This led to the confusion over the National Anthem and National Song,” said Gaud. The Supreme Court has said there is no concept of a ‘National Song’ in India but the general perception is that Vande Mataram is accorded this status. In Video:Confusion over National Anthem and Vande Mataram at Indore civic body meetDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MP Online kiosks charging girls portal f.description: INDORE: Some of the MP Online kiosks seem to have chose to ignore directorate of higher education’s (DHE) decision of not charging portal fees from girls registering for admissions. Some kiosks have been charging portal fee of Rs 50 from girls, who are getting registered for post graduate courses.This year for the first time DHE had made announcement that female candidates will not have to pay portal charges for any of rounds of registrations while boys have to pay Rs 50 separately apart from registration fees. “When I went to fill registration form for postgraduate course, I was asked to pay Rs 50 as portal charges. When I said that the charges were exempted, he said that the charges are exempted for undergraduate courses,” said candidate Aarti Sadashiv. Additional director of DHE Dr KN Chaturvedi said that the exemption of portal charges for female candidates is for both graduate and post graduate programmes and students can lodge complaint on helpline numbers provided by DHE in case kiosk is taking extra. “We have got to know that some of the students had complained in some colleges. Strict action will be taken and the kiosk will be blacklisted,” he said. First round of registrations for postgraduate courses started from June 15 and will continue till June 30. Around 3 lakh candidates have already registered for various undergraduate and postgraduate courses till Tuesday. The candidates will get three rounds of registrations including college-level counselling, which will be the third round. “Around 14 officers across state went for inspection and MP Online has taken action against 10 kiosks across the state after getting complaints,” said an official. According to official at Old GDC, helpdesk in Indore had received some verbal complaints and students were advised to take back money. However, no written complaints were filed. Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?"
